Limitations: Focused on sleep apnea not cardiac arrhythmia; single-lead ECG limits signal quality; memory decay mechanism adds complexity; per-segment analysis may miss context; clinical validation limited to two datasets

Title (APA Style): Hammouda, M., Shcherbak, A., Bril, E., Semenov, M., Sergiyenko, O., & Somov, A. (2024). Transfer learning for assessing Parkinson's disease: Analysis of wrist-worn sensors data and time-series imaging. Measurement, [volume].
Proposed Algorithm/Method: Transfer learning with ResNet applied to Time Series Imaging (TSI) — Gramian Angular Fields (GADF/GASF), Recurrence Plots, Markov Transition Fields, Continuous Wavelet Transform — from wrist-worn IMU sensors
Dataset Used: Custom dataset: 40 patients (wrist-worn tri-axis IMU, 9 exercises)
Accuracy/Performance: F1-score: 0.986 (HC vs PD); F1: 0.878 (PD staging); Perfect detection (F1=1.0) in arm-holding task
Limitations: Small dataset (40 patients); TSI image generation is computationally expensive; wrist sensor placement specific; exercise-dependent performance variability; not validated on standard public PD datasets; IMU sensor noise may affect results

Title (APA Style): Wagdarikar, N., & Jagtap, S. (2025). Two-way voice feature representation for disease detection based on voice using 1D and 2D deep convolution neural network. Applied Acoustics, 233, 110615.
Proposed Algorithm/Method: TWVFR: Two-Way Voice Feature Representation — parallel 1D DCNN (MVF: spectral, time-domain, voice quality features) + 2D DCNN (MFCC spectrograms), fused via Spider Monkey Optimization (SMO)
Dataset Used: Saarbruecken Voice Dataset (SVD)
Accuracy/Performance: Accuracy: 98.33% (4-class: Bulb Paralysis, Cyste, Polyp, Normal); Precision: 0.98; Recall: 0.98; F1: 0.98
Limitations: Tested on single dataset (SVD); 4-class classification only; SMO feature selection is computationally expensive; dual DCNN increases model complexity; limited to German language voice samples; not tested on PD-specific datasets
